results.title: Bernard Shaw's Caesar and Cleopatra
results.creator_credit: Gabriel Pascal and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Vivien Leigh stars in this spectacular film adaptation of George Bernard Shaw’s play, which at the time of its making, was the most expensive and elaborate film ever made in Britain. The play describes Caesar’s years in Alexandria and the overthrow of Cleopatra’s brother, Ptolomy, who occupies the Egyptian throne. This magnificent screen adaptation of this story of greed, war, passion and love, due to its superb script, acting and photography will remain one of the true classics of British film-making.

results.title: Bermuda, Bahama, Jamaica
results.creator_credit: Peter Teneyck and Video Trip Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rand McNally video visit trips”.
Tricia Springer takes you on a tour of three exotic ports of call in the Caribbean. Behind the picture postcard beauty of Bermuda is an island filled with activity, and British tradition. Turquoise waters and natural beauty await you in the Bahamas, which has a vital night life of discos, casinos and Las Vegas style shows. Jamaica is truly West Indian and is permeated by the calypso and reggae beats. Included are bonus tips on getting there, accommodation, food, special events, clothing and climate.

results.title: Berlin: Symphony of a Great City
results.brief_description: Berlin: Symphony of a Great City is a 1927 German silent film directed by Walter Ruttmann, co-written by Carl Mayer and Karl Freund. Composer Edmund Meisel was commissioned to write an orchestral score for its original release. Wikipedia

constellations_other.name: One of the first auteurs
constellations_other.description: A progenitor of modern film genres such as sci-fi, psychological thriller and serial killer films decades before such terms were coined, Austrian-born director Fritz Lang also enjoyed the occasional on-screen meta-moment.

results.description: A train speeds through the country on its way to Berlin, then gradually slows down as it pulls into the station. It is very early in the morning, about 5:00 AM, and the great city is mostly quiet. But before long there are some signs of activity, and a few early risers are to be seen on the streets. Soon the new day is well underway. It’s just a typical day in Berlin, but a day full of life and energy.
description_for_label: A train speeds through the country on its way to Berlin, then gradually slows down as it pulls into the station. It is very early in the morning, about 5:00 AM, and the great city is mostly quiet. But before long there are some signs of activity, and a few early risers are to be seen on the streets. Soon the new day is well underway. It’s just a typical day in Berlin, but a day full of life and energy.

results.title: Berlin: symphony of a great city
results.brief_description: A documentary by Walther Ruttman, dealing with a day in the life of a city and heavily influenced by Eisenstein’s ‘Potemkin’. Ruttman emphasized visual rhythms in his cutting and strove to give his films a symphonic organization and as such the film was widely influential to other filmmakers showing how the motifs of everyday life could be patterned thematically. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Berlin: outpost of freedom
results.brief_description: West Berlin is an outpost of freedom in the Russian dominated sector of East Germany, encroached on all sides by Soviet armed strength. Reporting factually on the current Berlin crisis, reviews the main events since World War II which have lead to the present situation. Thousands of refugees have fled from East to West Berlin in a desperate bid to escape the tyranny of the Communist regime. The threat by Russia to change the status of Berlin has become a problem of world proportions. No other credits available.

results.title: Bergensbanen
results.brief_description: Bergensbanen is a real-time documentary film of the entire journey by rail from Bergen to Oslo in Norway.

constellations_other.name: Taking it slow
constellations_other.description: Daniel Crooks' Phantom Ride offers a meditative journey through digital landscapes that make the viewer pause and reflect.

results.description: Bergensbanen is a real time documentary film of the entire journey by rail from Bergen to Oslo in Norway. The journey, lasting almost seven and a half hours, was filmed by cameras on the outside of the train, and is interspersed with interviews, archive footage and music. An alternative cut (the version commonly available on the internet) consists entirely of unbroken phantom ride footage.
description_for_label: Bergensbanen is a real time documentary film of the entire journey by rail from Bergen to Oslo in Norway. The journey, lasting almost seven and a half hours, was filmed by cameras on the outside of the train, and is interspersed with interviews, archive footage and music. An alternative cut (the version commonly available on the internet) consists entirely of unbroken phantom ride footage.

results.title: Berfunkle
results.creator_credit: Stu Knickerbocker, Bill Murray and Portafilms
results.brief_description: Introduces the problems involved in communication; in use of words as symbols of things and concepts. This animated film considers the problems of verbal communication as it follows the humorous misadventures of a poor soul trying to find the exact meaning of the word “Berfunkle”.
results.description: Introduces the problems involved in communication; in use of words as symbols of things and concepts. results.title: Berenice
results.brief_description:
Berenice (1670) marks a decisive point in Racine’s theatrical career, for with this play he found a felicitous combination of elements that he would use, without radical alteration, for the rest of his secular tragedies: a love interest, a relatively uncomplicated plot, striking rhetorical passages, and a highly poetic use of time. Berenice is built around the unusual premise of three characters who are ultimately forced to live apart because of their virtuous sense of duty. In the play, Titus, who is to become the new Roman emperor, and his friend Antiochus are both in love with Berenice, the queen of Palestine. The play’s “majestic sadness,” as Racine put it in his preface to the play, flows from the tragic necessity of separation for individuals who yearn for union with their beloved and who express their sorrow in some of the most haunting passages of Racine’s entire oeuvre. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica. Online. http://www.eb.com

Credits: Director, Jean Kerchbron ; photography, Jacques Lemare.
Cast: Rene Arrieu, Jacques destoop, Sylvia Monfort, Marcelle Ransom, Jacques Dacqmines, William Sabatier.

results.title: Bereavement in later life
results.creator_credit: Mike Crisp, Jo Marcus and A Webber
results.brief_description: Six retired people discuss their individual and fairly recent experiences of bereavement. Highlights the unique circumstances facing older people, including changes in lifestyle, socio-economic positions, roles, expectations and the complications that can arise. The overall aim is to show death and bereavement from an older person’s viewpoint, based on their life experiences.

results.title: Berberian Sound Studio
results.brief_description: In the 1970s, a British sound technician is brought to Italy to work on the sound effects for a gruesome horror film. His nightmarish task slowly takes over his psyche, driving him to confront his own past.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.
